TDLNM

Source: vignettes/TDLNM.Rmd
TDLNM.Rmd

This vignette demonstrates the implementation of treed distributed lag non-linear model (TDLNM). More details can be found in Mork and Wilson (2021) <doi: 10.1093/biostatistics/kxaa051>.

library(dlmtree)
#> This is dlmtree 1.0.0. For details visit https://danielmork.github.io/dlmtree/.
set.seed(1)

Fitting the model 

D <- sim.tdlnm(sim = "A", error.to.signal = 1)
fit <- dlmtree(formula = y ~ .,
               data = D$dat,
               exposure.data = D$exposures,
               dlm.type = "nonlinear", 
               family = "gaussian",
               n.burn = 2500, n.iter = 10000, n.thin = 5)
#> Preparing data...
#> 
#> Running TDLNM:
#> Burn-in % complete 
#> [0--------25--------50--------75--------100]
#>  ''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''
#> MCMC iterations (est time: 4 seconds)
#> [0--------25--------50--------75--------100]
#>  ''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''
#> Compiling results...

Model fit summary 

fit_sum <- summary(fit)
#> Centered DLNM at exposure value 0
fit_sum
#> ---
#> TDLNM summary
#> 
#> Model run info:
#> - y ~ . 
#> - family: gaussian 
#> - 20 trees
#> - 2500 burn-in iterations
#> - 10000 post-burn iterations
#> - 5 thinning factor
#> - 0.95 confidence level
#> 
#> Fixed effect coefficients:
#>               Mean   Lower  Upper
#> (Intercept) -3.581 -12.833  5.108
#> *c1          0.676   0.582  0.772
#> *c2          1.285   1.188  1.382
#> *c3          0.285   0.184  0.379
#> *c4         -0.993  -1.087 -0.899
#> *c5         -0.578  -0.681 -0.476
#> *b1         -2.466  -2.671 -2.270
#> *b2         -1.563  -1.759 -1.364
#> *b3          1.729   1.524  1.928
#> *b4          0.541   0.337  0.737
#> *b5         -1.507  -1.709 -1.307
#> ---
#> * = CI does not contain zero
#> 
#> DLNM effect:
#> range = [-1.027, 0.053]
#> signal-to-noise = 1.063
#> critical windows: 11-15

Exposure-time surface 

plot(fit_sum, 
     main = "Plot title", 
     xlab = "Time axis label", 
     ylab = "Exposure-concentration axis label", 
     flab = "Effect color label")
